intro: Hermione nutans, commonly known as the drooping Hermione, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its pendulous inflorescences and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Its leaves are ovate with a hairy texture, and the stems are often covered in fine pubescence. It is native to parts of Africa and is cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
